title: Designing SMathHacks 2025
summary: A brief overview of my thought process behind designing North Carolina’s largest hackathon for high schoolers.

title: Building Smart Glasses to Empower Independence
summary: After being mesmerized by https://about.fb.com/news/2023/09/new-ray-ban-meta-smart-glasses/'s $329 smart glasses, I knew I had to see what I could do with accessible components and a patient-first mindset.

title: What’s in my Homelab?
summary: Ever since quarantine began, I’ve been fascinated with the ins and outs of networking, servers, and containerization. Here’s what’s in it…

title: MoodFlip: Act on Emotional Insights with Selfies
summary: I built MoodFlip by leveraging toolkits and APIs from Hume & OpenAI. Enabling you to be actionable with your emotions—just choose what to sustain or remedy.

title: Lost in Translation: Adapting Language Tech for Autism Detection in Spanish-Speaking Children
summary: Here’s a conversation I had with Oscar Moreno-Lizarazo, an upcoming MD candidate @ Harvard, after I reached out to him on LinkedIn. We discussed his and his team’s work with the PANDABox at UNC Chapel Hill—enabling them to bridge the gap between Spanish-Speakers and proactive Autism healthcare.

title: Mind Reader or Doomed Gimmick?: Neurotech in the Apple Vision Pro
summary: As we all tuned into WWDC earlier this month—eagerly awaiting for one more thing—we all knew Apple’s take on AR/VR was inevitable if the leaks were to be trusted. Finally, the mind reading tech was revealed in all its seamless solid aluminum and glass glory. Now let’s take a look at the neuroscience and tech behind it all!

title: Exciting Breakthroughs with Alzheimer’s: Exploring Neuronal Hyperexcitability
summary: After a shadowing event, I was lucky enough to have a discussion over email with Liza Chartampila, a Ph.D. Student from the Diering Lab at UNC Chapel Hill, regarding a promising indicator of Alzheimer’s. Here’s how it went…
